intro: Zyrphelis monticola, commonly known as the mountain zyrphelis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central and South America. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, adapted to withstand strong winds and low temperatures. Zyrphelis monticola plays a role in pollination by attracting hummingbirds and other nectar-feeding insects.
